I've noticed in Quest 4.02 that when I create a conditional statement in a Script Editor box and then try to create another one in the same box that the first conditional statement will be deleted.  I've found that the only way to get another conditional statement to stick is by clicking the non-conditional "+" sign and then clicking the add-conditional icon.  (this needs to be corrected).

And, in a Script Editor box, if I copy a conditional command and then try to paste it in the same Script Editor box, it's not allowed (this needs to be corrected). - Sometimes it's easier to copy a conditional statement if another one is similar, but maybe has different flag names, etc. P.s.: it will work if I exit out of the Script Editor box and then return, but that gets annoying.

And, in a Script Editor box, if a command is twice clicked on it will erase the command... why?  Seemes to chancy, and that's why the delete option exists (needs to be corrected).
Posts.HTML:
I've noticed in Quest 4.02 that when I create a conditional statement in a Script Editor box and then try to create another one in the same box that the first conditional statement will be deleted. I've found that the only way to get another conditional statement to stick is by clicking the non-conditional "+" sign and then clicking the add-conditional icon. (this needs to be corrected).

And, in a Script Editor box, if I copy a conditional command and then try to paste it in the same Script Editor box, it's not allowed (this needs to be corrected). - Sometimes it's easier to copy a conditional statement if another one is similar, but maybe has different flag names, etc. P.s.: it will work if I exit out of the Script Editor box and then return, but that gets annoying.

And, in a Script Editor box, if a command is twice clicked on it will erase the command... why? Seemes to chancy, and that's why the delete option exists (needs to be corrected).
